page.title: 06HISTORICAL PLACES IN ROTHLEY
page.content: {Rothley Court Hotel,}former manor house,dating from Crusader times, still has the Knights Templar chapel. Its lands are rented by the local farmer and grazed by sheep and cattle. The Cricket Club is also in its former grounds.Inside modernisation makes it warm and comfortable.Thomas Babington MacCaulay essayist and historian was born here. Wilberforce drafted the abolition of slavery bill here. {The Grange},a former Reeves house is now used by the Severn Trent Water Authority and the Social Services. {The Parish Church}with 15th century tower with Norman font is warm and adapted inside. {Domestic Buildings,}Rothley has the greatest number of Cruck constructed cottages in any Leicestershire village Styles vary from early cottage,thro' timber,stone to 20th Century houses.
